materials.raw_text: O: 12 g, Pr: 5 g, W: 1 g, Zr: 1 g

sourcing.instructions: O (Oxygen source, e.g., potassium peroxydisulfate) can be purchased from chemical suppliers. Pr (Praseodymium oxide) can be obtained from rare earth material suppliers. W (Tungsten powder) is available from metal suppliers. Zr (Zirconium powder) can be sourced from specialty metal suppliers.
steps: O (Oxygen source, e.g., potassium peroxydisulfate) can be purchased from chemical suppliers. Pr (Praseodymium oxide) can be obtained from rare earth material suppliers. W (Tungsten powder) is available from metal suppliers. Zr (Zirconium powder) can be sourced from specialty metal suppliers.

1. Measure out 12 g of potassium peroxydisulfate and place it in a clean mixing container. 2. Add 5 g of praseodymium oxide to the container. 3. Include 1 g of tungsten powder and 1 g of zirconium powder. 4. Use a ceramic or glass stirring rod to thoroughly mix the powders until a uniform mixture is achieved. 5. Ensure to wear appropriate PPE (gloves, goggles) during this process.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure out 12 g of potassium peroxydisulfate and place it in a clean mixing container. 2. Add 5 g of praseodymium oxide to the container. 3. Include 1 g of tungsten powder and 1 g of zirconium powder. 4. Use a ceramic or glass stirring rod to thoroughly mix the powders until a uniform mixture is achieved. 5. Ensure to wear appropriate PPE (gloves, goggles) during this process.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace and heat to 1200°C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure proper bonding of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace and heat to 1200°C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure proper bonding of the materials.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool down naturally to room temperature. 2. This cooling process should take approximately 6-8 hours to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool down naturally to room temperature. 2. This cooling process should take approximately 6-8 hours to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Inspect for any rough edges or imperfections. 3. Use fine-grit sandpaper to smooth any rough surfaces. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance the surface finish and protect the material. Allow the sealant to cure as per the manufacturer’s instructions.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Inspect for any rough edges or imperfections. 3. Use fine-grit sandpaper to smooth any rough surfaces. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance the surface finish and protect the material. Allow the sealant to cure as per the manufacturer’s instructions.
